question: Question_01_(d)
sols:
Let $A = \begin{bmatrix} 
0 & 2 \\ 
1 & 0
\end{bmatrix}, U = \begin{bmatrix}
0 &1 \\ 
1& 0
\end{bmatrix}, B = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0\\ 
0& 2
\end{bmatrix}$

Observe that $U^{-1}$ = $U^{T}$ and all entries are real, so U is an
orthogonal matrix. This means that
$\begin{Vmatrix}U\end{Vmatrix}\begin{Vmatrix}B\end{Vmatrix} = \begin{Vmatrix}B\end{Vmatrix} = \begin{Vmatrix}A\end{Vmatrix}$

$\begin{Vmatrix}B\end{Vmatrix} = 2$

because the norm of a diagonal matrix is the entry with the largest
magnitude.

and therefore, $\begin{Vmatrix}A\end{Vmatrix} = 2$.

Next, notice that

$\displaystyle A^{-1} = B^{-1}U^{-1} = B^{-1} U$

Once again, since U is orthogonal,

$\begin{Vmatrix}A^{-1}\end{Vmatrix} = \begin{Vmatrix}B^{-1}\end{Vmatrix}$

As

$B^{-1} = \begin{bmatrix}1 && 0 \\ 0 && 1/2\end{bmatrix}$

we have that $\begin{Vmatrix}B^{-1}\end{Vmatrix} = 1$. Thus

$\begin{Vmatrix}A\end{Vmatrix}\begin{Vmatrix}A^{-1}\end{Vmatrix} = 2\cdot 1 = 2$

therefore, cond(A) = 2
